Presently, the entry level qualification into M.Pharmacy is B,Pharmacy with minimum marks of 55%. Admissions are made through three tier based:
Entry through a Common Test called GPAT[Graduate Pharmacy Aptitude Test] conducted under the anspices of National Monitoring committee, All India Council for Technical Education, New Delhi.
Entry through a Common test called PGCET[Post Graduate Engineering Common Entrance Test] conducted by AP State Council of Higher Education.
Entry through Management quota.

Course: M.Pharma Pharmaceutical Analysis and Quality Assurance
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity: Candidates who have passed in B. Pharmacy Degree from any AICTE (All India Council for Technical Education) recognized College/ University with not less than 50% of the Maximum Marks (Aggregate of 4 years in B.Pharmacy). Admission is made through GPAT and/or PGECET for A-Category Seats.
Course_Detail: Master of Pharmacy in Pharmaceutical Analysis and Quality Assurance is 2-year duration course approved by AICTE, Pharmacy Council of India and affiliated to Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Hyderabad.
